tagline: Simple Management System for Hadoop MapReduce Job.
name: Huahin Manager
body:
## Huahin Manager Huahin Manager is Simple Management System for Hadoop MapReduce Job. Huahin can get a list of MapReduce jobs, get status, do a kill for the job, and Job queue management. Huahin Manager is distributed under Apache License 2.0. ### Download [Huahin Manager 0.1.3 for Apache Hadoop 1.0.3](https://github.com/downloads/huahin/huahin-manager/huahin-manager-a-0.1.3.tar.gz)
[Huahin Manager 0.1.3 for CDH3u4](https://github.com/downloads/huahin/huahin-manager/huahin-manager-c-0.1.3.tar.gz)
### Requirements ``` Java 6+ ```
### Install Huahin Manager ``` ~ $ tar xzf huahin-manager-x.x.x.tar.gz ```
### Configure Huahin Manager Edit the huahin-manager-x.x.x/conf/huahinManager.properties file and set mapred.job.tracker property to the JobTracker URI, set fs.default.name property to the NameNode URI, and set job.queue.limit property to the job queue limit. job queue limit is 0, does not manage the queue. For example: ``` mapred.job.tracker=localhost:9001 fs.default.name=hdfs://localhost:9000 job.queue.limit=2 ``` When you change the boot port, edit the huahin-manager-x.x.x/conf/port file.
### Start/Stop Huahin Manager To start/stop Huahin Manager use Huahin Manager's bin/manager script. For example: ``` $ bin/manager start ```
### Test Huahin Manager is working ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list" [ { "jobid": "job_201205111223_0001", "mapComplete": "100.0%", "name": "JOB_EBCF7626A41F34B4C7276DB2B152336F", "priority": "NORMAL", "reduceComplete": "100.0%", "schedulingInfo": "NA", "startTime": "Fri May 11 12:25:18 JST 2012", "state": "SUCCEEDED", "user": "huahin" } ] ```
### Huahin Manager on the Amazon Elastic MapReduce Huahin Manager will be able to run on Amazon Elastic MapReduce by setting the bootstrap. ##### Setup of Security Group Set the your IP address and port(9010) for the Huahin Manager to the Security Group(ElasticMapReduce-master). For example: * Port range: 9010 * Source: 1.1.1.1/32 ##### Starting The Amazon Elastic MapReduce. References bootstrap is as follows: ``` s3://huahin/manager/configure ``` The following is an example run using Ruby Client(elastic-mapreduce). ``` ~ $ elastic-mapreduce --create --alive \ --master-instance-type m1.large --slave-instance-type m1.small \ --num-instances 2 \ --bootstrap-action s3://huahin/manager/configure ``` After checking the Public DNS Name for the Master Node, you can use the API of the Huahin Manager. ``` ~ $ elastic-mapreduce --describe --jobflow j-XXXXXXXXX { "JobFlows": [ { ... "Instances": { ... "MasterPublicDnsName": "ec2-1-2-3-4.compute-1.amazonaws.com", ... } } ] } ~ $ curl -X GET "http://ec2-1-2-3-4.compute-1.amazonaws.com:9010/job/list" ```
### Huahin Manager REST Job APIs Get all job list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list" ```
Get failed job list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list/failed" ```
Get killed job list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list/killed" ```
Get prep job list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list/prep" ```
Get running job list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list/running" ```
Get succeeded job list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/list/succeeded" ```
Get job status. specifies the jobid. ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/status/" ``` For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/status/job_201205111223_0001" ```
Get job detail. specifies the jobid. ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/detail/" ``` For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/job/detail/job_201205111223_0001" ```
Register job. JAR=@ specifies the run jar file. ARGUMENTS specifies the JSON. specifies the run class. arguments: specifies the run arguments array. ``` ~ $ curl -X POST "http://:9010/job/register -F JAR=@ -F ARGUMENTS='{"class":"","arguments":["",""]}' ``` For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X POST "http://:9010/job/register -F JAR=@mapreduce.jar -F ARGUMENTS='{"class":"examples.WordCount","arguments":["/user/huahin/input","/user/huahin/output"]}' ```
Kill job for ID. specifies the job ID. ``` ~ $ curl -X DELETE "http://:9010/job/kill/id/" ``` For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X DELETE "http://:9010/job/kill/id/job_201205111223_0001" ```
Kill job for job name. specifies the job name. ``` ~ $ curl -X DELETE "http://:9010/job/kill/name/" ``` For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X DELETE "http://:9010/job/kill/name/WORD_COUNT_JOB" ```
### Huahin Manager REST queue APIs Get all queue list. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/queue/list" ```
Get run queue statuses. For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X GET "http://:9010/queue/statuses" ```
Kill queue for ID. specifies the queue ID. ``` ~ $ curl -X DELETE "http://:9010/queue/kill/" ``` For example: ``` ~ $ curl -X DELETE "http://:9010/queue/kill/Q_20120608180129594" ```
### Support or Contact Contact huahin-framework@googlegroups.com and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
